summary.para: A structure that is used to specify a set of callbacks that can transform the content type and encoded bytes of a received message.

remarks.para: A WS_CHANNEL may wish to decompress, modify, or otherwise transform the encoded bytes of a message as soon as they are received. A WS_CHANNEL_DECODER
provides the necessary hooks to intercept and perform these modifications.
When creating the channel, the should be set with the appropriate functions.
The callbacks specified will get invoked according to the following grammar:
remarks.code: decodercalls := create decoderloop* free decoderloop := decodestart | decodestart getcontenttype | decodestart getcontenttype (decode*) | decodestart getcontenttype (decode*) decodeend
remarks.para: The decoder may not see the full decode sequence for a message if the channel or the decoder encounters an error while reading the message. A decoder must be prepared to handle transitioning to the appropriate state based upon the callbacks invoked.
When using with , the content type is fixed for the channel. In this case, the WS_DECODER_GET_CONTENT_TYPE_CALLBACK must return exactly the same value for the content type of every message.
The WS_DECODER_END_CALLBACK will not be invoked until WS_DECODER_DECODE_CALLBACK returns 0 bytes.
When the channel is finished using the decoder instance it will free it via the WS_FREE_DECODER_CALLBACK.

summary.para: A context that will be passed to the WS_CREATE_DECODER_CALLBACK.
A WS_CREATE_DECODER_CALLBACK callback that creates an instance of a decoder.
A WS_DECODER_GET_CONTENT_TYPE_CALLBACK callback that is invoked to get the content type of the message.
A WS_DECODER_START_CALLBACK callback that is invoked at the start of decoding a message.
A WS_DECODER_DECODE_CALLBACK callback that is invoked to decode a message.
A WS_DECODER_END_CALLBACK callback that is invoked at the end of decoding a message.
A WS_FREE_DECODER_CALLBACK callback that frees an instance of a decoder.
